metadata.title: CVE-2019-10222 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Ceph RGW configuration with Beast as the front endhandling client requests. An unauthenticated attacker could crash the CephRGW server by sending valid HTTP headers and terminating the connection,resulting in a remote denial of service for Ceph RGW clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-base - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-common - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-fuse - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-mds - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-mgr - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-mon - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-osd - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-resource-agents - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
ceph-test - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libcephfs-java - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libcephfs-jni - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libcephfs2 - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
librados2 - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libradosstriper1 - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
librbd1 - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
librgw2 - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python-ceph - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python-cephfs - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python-rados - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python-rbd - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python-rgw - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python3-ceph-argparse - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python3-cephfs - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python3-rados - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python3-rbd - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
python3-rgw - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
radosgw - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
rbd-fuse - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
rbd-mirror - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
rbd-nbd - 12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.2.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
